trivia: Will Howard was a highly-touted high school quarterback, but he was also a standout basketball player who received scholarship offers to play college basketball.

Aaron Rodgers holds the NFL record for the highest touchdown-to-interception ratio in league history. He also famously taped potato chips to the bottom of his heels during footwork drills to force himself to stay on his toes.
Mason Rudolph was a record-setting quarterback at Oklahoma State, where he won the Johnny Unitas Golden Arm Award as a senior, an award given to the nation's top quarterback.
Skylar Thompson was a three-sport athlete in high school, excelling in football, basketball, and baseball. He also earned a black belt in taekwondo at a young age.
Kenneth Gainwell, before transferring to Memphis, was a highly successful high school quarterback who led his team to a state championship.
Kaleb Johnson, a running back, was a top-tier track and field athlete in high school, where he competed in the 100-meter dash and the long jump.
Jaylen Warren earned a scholarship to Oklahoma State after spending time at Snow College, a junior college in Utah. He was an undrafted free agent who worked his way onto the Steelers' roster.
Calvin Anderson is a master of the Rubik's Cube and can solve it behind his back and blindfolded. He was the first professional athlete to become a brand ambassador for the Rubik's Cube company.
Spencer Anderson, an offensive lineman, played multiple positions on the offensive line during his college career at Maryland, showcasing his versatility.
Troy Fautanu, an offensive tackle, is of Samoan descent and his family has a strong tradition of producing football players.
Zach Frazier was a four-time state champion wrestler in high school and set a school record with 159 career wins. His wrestling background is often credited with his success on the football field.
Broderick Jones, a first-round draft pick, won two national championships as a starting offensive lineman at the University of Georgia.
Ryan McCollum, a center, was a team captain at Texas A&M and was a finalist for the Rimington Trophy, which is awarded to the nation's best college center.
Mason McCormick, a guard, was a four-year starter at South Dakota State and was a key part of an offensive line that helped the team win a national championship.
Andrus Peat is a three-time Pro Bowl selection and was a first-round draft pick in the 2015 NFL Draft. His father, Todd Peat, also played in the NFL.
Isaac Seumalo is of Samoan descent, and his father, Joe Seumalo, is a long-time college football coach.
Pat Freiermuth was nicknamed 'Baby Gronk' by his teammates due to his physical playing style and resemblance to tight end Rob Gronkowski.
Jonnu Smith, a tight end, was a college teammate of New England Patriots quarterback Mac Jones at Florida International.
Darnell Washington, a tight end, was a five-star recruit coming out of high school and committed to Georgia at the Under Armour All-America Game.
Connor Heyward is the younger brother of Steelers defensive tackle Cameron Heyward. Their father, Craig 'Ironhead' Heyward, was also a Pro Bowl running back in the NFL.
Calvin Austin III was a star track and field athlete at Memphis, where he set school records in the 60-meter and 200-meter indoor dashes.
DK Metcalf is one of only two players in NFL history, along with Randy Moss, with 50 receptions, 900 yards and five touchdowns in each of their first six seasons.
Scotty Miller won a Super Bowl with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Super Bowl LV. He was a walk-on at Bowling Green and finished his college career with 21 touchdowns.
Ben Skowronek won Super Bowl LVI with the Los Angeles Rams. He is a distant cousin of the 1947 Heisman Trophy winner Johnny Lujack.
Roman Wilson, a wide receiver, was a key player on the Michigan Wolverines' 2023 national championship team.
Keeanu Benton, a defensive tackle, was a two-time state champion wrestler in high school in Wisconsin, compiling a record of 90-1.
Yahya Black was a standout at Iowa, where he was named to the All-Big Ten Freshman team in 2021.
Daniel Ekuale, a defensive tackle, is of Samoan descent and played college football at Washington State.
Derrick Harmon, a defensive lineman, was a highly productive player at Michigan State where he earned All-Big Ten honors.
Cameron Heyward has been selected as a team captain for the Steelers for ten consecutive seasons, which is a franchise record. His father was former NFL running back Craig 'Ironhead' Heyward.
Logan Lee was an accomplished wrestler in high school and won a state championship. He was a walk-on at Iowa and earned a scholarship.
Isaiahh Loudermilk, a defensive end, played his college football at Wisconsin, where he was a key member of a stout defense.
Esezi Otomewo, a defensive lineman, was born in Minnesota to Nigerian parents. He was an Academic All-Big Ten selection while at the University of Minnesota.
Carson Bruener, a linebacker, was a two-time captain at Washington and was a key part of their defense that made a run to the national championship game.
Malik Harrison, a linebacker, was a multi-sport athlete in high school, playing basketball and running track in addition to football.
Nick Herbig, a linebacker, is the younger brother of former NFL offensive lineman Nate Herbig. He was a two-time first-team All-Big Ten selection at Wisconsin.
Alex Highsmith was a walk-on at Charlotte before earning a scholarship and becoming one of the most productive pass rushers in college football.
Cole Holcomb was a star linebacker at North Carolina, where he led the team in tackles for three consecutive seasons.
Patrick Queen was a key member of the LSU Tigers' national championship team in 2019. He was named the Defensive MVP of the College Football Playoff National Championship.
T.J. Watt is the younger brother of former NFL defensive stars J.J. Watt and Derek Watt. He tied the NFL's single-season sack record with 22.5 sacks in 2021.
Jack Sawyer, a linebacker, was a five-star recruit coming out of high school and was a highly-touted prospect.
Payton Wilson, a linebacker, was an All-American at North Carolina State and was the winner of the Chuck Bednarik Award as the nation's best defensive player in 2023.
Brandin Echols was a state champion in the long jump in high school and also played basketball.
Chuck Clark was originally drafted by the Baltimore Ravens, the Steelers' rival, and spent his first six seasons with the team before joining the Steelers.
DeShon Elliott, a safety, was an All-American at Texas and was a finalist for the Jim Thorpe Award, given to the nation's best defensive back.
Donte Kent, a cornerback, was a standout at Central Michigan where he earned All-MAC honors.
Miles Killebrew, a safety and special teams ace, was named to the Pro Bowl as a special teams player in 2021 and 2023.
Joey Porter Jr. is the son of former Steelers linebacker and Super Bowl champion Joey Porter Sr. His father also coached for the Steelers.

Jalen Ramsey is a three-time All-Pro and a six-time Pro Bowl selection. He was a two-sport athlete at Florida State, also competing in track and field where he won a national championship in the long jump.
Darius Slay, a six-time Pro Bowl cornerback, is nicknamed 'Big Play Slay' for his ability to make game-changing plays.
Juan Thornhill won two Super Bowls with the Kansas City Chiefs before signing with the Cleveland Browns and then the Steelers.
Chris Boswell's 59-yard field goal in 2022 is the longest in Steelers franchise history.
Corliss Waitman was born in Ghent, Belgium, and is one of the few NFL players to be born in that country.

Christian Kuntz was a dominant college linebacker at Duquesne, where he set a school record with 30.5 sacks. He later transitioned to long snapper in order to have a better chance at making an NFL roster.
